APPROACH
‘‘among patients with cardiac tamponade, a minority will not have dyspnea, tachycardia,
elevated JVP, or cardiomegaly on chest radiograph. A pulsus paradoxus >10 mmHg among patients with a
pericardial effusion helps distinguish those with cardiac tamponade from those without. Diagnostic certainty
of the presence of tamponade requires additional testing’’
JAMA 2007 297:16
